Pre-Game Insights: The 2024 Copa América was the 48th edition of the Copa América, the quadrennial international men's soccer championship organized by South America's football ruling body CONMEBOL. The tournament was held in the United States and co-organized by CONCACAF.
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is the second time that the United States is hosting the tournament, having hosted the Copa América Centenario in 2016.
Others: The tournament will include sixteen teams – ten from CONMEBOL and six from CONCACAF. All ten CONMEBOL national teams are eligible to enter. The six CONCACAF participants will qualify through the 2023–24 CONCACAF Nations League.
